title: Why Brexitcast mastermind Heidi Dawson can only be good news for BBC 5 Live
text:
The great thing about BBC 5 Live is that the BBC's management almost seems to forget it exists sometimes, so they haven't ruined it yet. 5 Live doesn’t seem to attract nearly as much public angst as Radio 4 does. I sometimes get the impression that BBC bosses just think of 5 Live as the place that does the cricket updates and not much else.

But the network has 5.34 million weekly listeners for its mixture of sport, news, politics and entertainment. It also quietly has some of the best on-air talent at the BBC: Emma Barnett on the morning political interviews, Elly Oldroyd on sport, Mark Kermode and Simon Mayo on film.
